tones.name: Joking
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message was a joke.

tones.name: Half-Joking
tones.description: Used to indicate a message was said in a joke-like manner, but is semi-serious.

tones.name: Sarcastic
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message was sarcastic or includes sarcasm.

tones.name: Genuine
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message was made with genuine intentions.

tones.name: Serious
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message is serious and is intended to be taken seriously.

tones.name: Non-Serious
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message is not serious and shouldn't be taken seriously.

tones.name: Positive Connotation
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message has a positive connotation.

tones.name: Neutral Connotation
tones.description: A tone indicating a message has a neutral connotation.

tones.name: Negative Connotation
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message has a negative connotation.

tones.name: Platonic
tones.description: A tone used when a message is meant to be taken platonically

tones.name: Romantic
tones.description: A tone used when a message is meant to be taken romantically.

tones.name: Light-Hearted
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message is light-hearted, carefree, or cheerful.

tones.name: Little Upset
tones.description: A tone used when the sender wants to indicate they're a little upset.

tones.name: Nobody Here
tones.description: A tone used when someone wants to indicate their post isn't directed at any recipient.

tones.name: Rhetorical
tones.description: A tone used when a question is rhetorical and not meant to be answered.

tones.name: Teasing
tones.description: A tone used when a user intends to tease.

tones.name: Inside Joke
tones.description: A tone used to mark any inside joke that other recipients might not get.

tones.name: Metaphorical
tones.description: A tone used to mark a message as metaphorical.

tones.name: Literal
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message is literal.

tones.name: Hyperbole
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message is hyperbole (an exaggeration)

tones.name: Fake
tones.description: A tone used to mark something as fake or a lie.

tones.name: Not Mad
tones.description: A tone used when a sender wants to indicate they're not mad.

tones.name: Copypasta
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message is a copypasta (usually humorous copy-pasted texts).

tones.name: Lyrics
tones.description: A tone used to indicate a message contains lyrics to a song.
